meanings.definition: Showing a willingness to take surprisingly bold risks.
meanings.sent1: The audacious explorer ventured into the unknown jungle.
meanings.sent2: She made an audacious move by quitting her job to start her own business.
meanings.sent3: The audacious squirrel stole a whole bag of nuts from the picnic.
meanings.sent4: His audacious plan to climb the tallest mountain seemed impossible but inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The audacious decision to skydive left a lasting impression on her.

meanings.definition: Showing an impudent lack of respect.
meanings.sent1: The audacious student talked back to the teacher in class.
meanings.sent2: Her audacious behavior at the formal event shocked everyone.
meanings.sent3: The audacious cat knocked over the vase and walked away nonchalantly.
meanings.sent4: His audacious disregard for authority led to many conflicts.
meanings.sent5: The audacious graffiti on the wall was a bold statement of rebellion.

meanings.sent1: The audacious stunt performer amazed the audience with his dangerous tricks.
meanings.sent2: She wore an audacious outfit that turned heads wherever she went.
meanings.sent3: The audacious idea of building a house on a tree made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His audacious decision to sail around the world solo was both brave and risky.
meanings.sent5: The audacious escape plan involved jumping off the roof with a makeshift parachute.
